title: Harvesting and Storing Water for Crop Irrigation

tasks.task: Water harvesting and irrigation system operation
subtasks: Observe and understand the concept of water harvesting for irrigation
Identify the water source (Limestone Creek and its leg)
Operate the pump to transfer water from Limestone Creek into the reservoir
Measure and manage the reservoir's water capacity (140 acre-feet)
Calculate water usage during the growing season
Assess the system's benefits during drought conditions
Evaluate the suitability of water harvesting for small-scale farming and specialty crops
Consider potential applications for municipal backup water supplies
Access and provide information through the Alabama Cooperative Extension System's website
Monitor water levels in the reservoir during wet periods (November to March)
Plan and schedule water pumping into the reservoir
Schedule irrigation water withdrawal during the growing season
Maintain proper water allocation for agricultural use
Understand the demand for irrigation water during dry times
Implement strategies to reduce reliance on strained groundwater resources
Explore alternative water sources for irrigation
Promote sustainable agricultural practices through water conservation
Provide educational resources and information on water harvesting systems
